banner.note: Note: Token conversion is permanent and cannot be reversed.

hero.title: Uncage Your <1/> <2>Assets</2>
hero.subtitle: Seamlessly bridge TigerOG tokens across chains using Axelar's Interchain Token Service. Secure, fast, and tax-free.

features.title: Interchain Token Service
features.description: Freedom Bridge leverages Axelar ITS to deliver a seamless, secure, and tax-free bridging experience across {{count}}+ blockchains.

stopDecay.title: Stop the Decay
stopDecay.description: Legacy tokens burn 10-11% of your value on every buy and sell. Converting to TigerOG stops this bleed immediately, preserving 100% of your value.

conversion.title: 1:1 Conversion
conversion.description: Total supply never changes. Tokens are held in a secure conversion contract, and an exact 1:1 equivalent is used. No inflation, no dilution.

multichain.title: Multi-Chain
multichain.description: Deploy once, access everywhere. Your asset becomes a native interchain token across chains including Ethereum, BNB Chain, Base, and more.

security.title: Axelar Security
security.description: Powered by Axelar's decentralized network of validators. ITS ensures your tokens are transferred securely and consistently across all connected networks.

cta.title: Ready to bridge?
cta.description: Join the interchain revolution. It takes less than a minute to convert your tokens and start bridging via Axelar.

buyTokens.title: Acquire Assets
buyTokens.description: Don't have any tokens yet? Buy the original tokens on PancakeSwap, then convert them to the new multichain versions.

header.title: Documentation
header.subtitle: Learn how to convert legacy tokens and bridge across chains.

whatIs.title: What is Freedom Bridge?
whatIs.content: Freedom Bridge is a decentralized bridging protocol built on Axelar's Interchain Token Service (ITS). It enables you to convert legacy tokens into tax-free, interchain-compatible assets that can move freely across supported blockchains.
whatIs.taxFreeDesc: Legacy tokens often have 10%+ taxes. TigerOG tokens have 0% tax.
whatIs.omnichainDesc: Move assets instantly between {{count}}+ blockchains via Axelar.

howToConvert.title: How to Convert Tokens
howToConvert.step1: Connect your wallet to the source chain (e.g., BNB Chain).
howToConvert.step3: Select the legacy token you want to convert.
howToConvert.step4: Approve the Conversion contract to spend your tokens.
howToConvert.step5: Click Convert to deposit your legacy tokens and receive an equivalent amount of "TigerOG" tokens.
howToConvert.note: Note: Conversion incurs the legacy token's transaction tax (during the upgrade) if your token charges tax on transfers. However, once converted into TigerOG, all subsequent transfers and bridges are tax-free.

supportedNetworks.title: Supported Networks
supportedNetworks.content: Freedom Bridge supports a growing ecosystem of {{count}}+ blockchains, enabling seamless interoperability across the EVM landscape via Axelar.

xerc20.title: Interchain Tokens
xerc20.content: Axelar Interchain Token Service (ITS) allows tokens to be deployed across multiple chains with a consistent address and unified supply management. Freedom Bridge utilizes ITS to ensure that TigerOG remains a canonical asset wherever it is bridged.

axelar.title: Axelar Network
axelar.content: We utilize Axelar as our interoperability layer. Axelar is a decentralized network that connects different blockchains, enabling secure cross-chain communication and asset transfers. Axelar's security model relies on a permissionless set of validators, providing high-grade security for interchain tokens.

conversion.title: Conversion Logic
conversion.content: The Conversion contract is deployed on BSC. When you convert, your legacy tokens are sent to the dead address (permanently burned) and you receive TigerOG at a 1:1 ratio. This is a one-way process — the legacy tokens are destroyed and can never be recovered.

security.title: Security Model
security.content: Security is built into every layer of Freedom Bridge:
security.point1: Conversion Architecture: Legacy tokens are permanently burned via verified, immutable smart contracts.
security.point2: Axelar Validators: Cross-chain messages are verified by Axelar's decentralized network.
security.point3: Consistent Supply: ITS manages minting and burning to maintain a constant total supply across all chains.
security.point4: Audited Logic: Built on industry-standard Axelar and OpenZeppelin libraries.

supplyCommon.verificationDesc: All supply figures can be independently verified on-chain:

tigerogSupply.title: TigerOG Supply Breakdown
tigerogSupply.intro: TigerOG has a fixed circulating supply derived from the original BNBTiger token. The supply calculation accounts for all burned and permanently locked tokens.
tigerogSupply.deadAddressDesc: Tokens sent to 0x000...dEaD are permanently burned and can never be recovered. This includes tokens burned through the original BNBTiger tax mechanism.
tigerogSupply.contractBalanceDesc: A small amount of tokens are stuck in the BNBTiger contract itself. These tokens are inaccessible and effectively removed from circulation.
tigerogSupply.lpLockedDesc: The PancakeSwap liquidity pool contains BNBTiger tokens paired with BNB. When LP tokens are burned (sent to the dead address), the underlying tokens in the pool become permanently locked.
tigerogSupply.lpBurnedPercent: LP tokens burned: 86.18% of all LP tokens
tigerogSupply.lpLockedPercent: Therefore, 86.18% of tokens in the LP are permanently locked
tigerogSupply.note: Note: TigerOG maintains a 1:1 ratio with BNBTiger during conversion. The circulating supply of TigerOG matches the true circulating supply of BNBTiger after accounting for all burned and locked tokens.
tigerogSupply.launchData: Launch Data: These figures were calculated at launch. The legacy BNBTiger token continues to burn tokens on each buy/sell transaction, so the actual circulating supply may be slightly lower than shown.

lionogSupply.title: LionOG Supply Breakdown
lionogSupply.intro: LionOG has a fixed circulating supply derived from the original BNBLion token. The supply calculation accounts for all burned and permanently locked tokens.
lionogSupply.deadAddressDesc: Tokens sent to 0x000...dEaD are permanently burned and can never be recovered. This includes tokens burned through the original BNBLion tax mechanism.
lionogSupply.contractBalanceDesc: A small amount of tokens are stuck in the BNBLion contract itself. These tokens are inaccessible and effectively removed from circulation.
lionogSupply.lpLockedDesc: The PancakeSwap liquidity pool contains BNBLion tokens paired with BNB. When LP tokens are burned (sent to the dead address), the underlying tokens in the pool become permanently locked.
lionogSupply.lpBurnedPercent: LP tokens burned: 99.98% of all LP tokens
lionogSupply.lpLockedPercent: Therefore, 99.98% of tokens in the LP are permanently locked
lionogSupply.note: Note: LionOG maintains a 1:1 ratio with BNBLion during conversion. The circulating supply of LionOG matches the true circulating supply of BNBLion after accounting for all burned and locked tokens.
lionogSupply.launchData: Launch Data: These figures were calculated at launch. The legacy BNBLion token continues to burn tokens on each buy/sell transaction, so the actual circulating supply may be slightly lower than shown.

frogogSupply.title: FrogOG Supply Breakdown
frogogSupply.intro: FrogOG has a fixed circulating supply derived from the original BNBFrog token. The supply calculation accounts for all burned and permanently locked tokens.
frogogSupply.deadAddressDesc: Tokens sent to 0x000...dEaD are permanently burned and can never be recovered. This includes tokens burned through the original BNBFrog tax mechanism.
frogogSupply.contractBalanceDesc: A small amount of tokens are stuck in the BNBFrog contract itself. These tokens are inaccessible and effectively removed from circulation.
frogogSupply.lpLockedDesc: The PancakeSwap liquidity pool contains BNBFrog tokens paired with BNB. When LP tokens are burned (sent to the dead address), the underlying tokens in the pool become permanently locked.
frogogSupply.lpBurnedPercent: LP tokens burned: 99.31% of all LP tokens
frogogSupply.lpLockedPercent: Therefore, 99.31% of tokens in the LP are permanently locked
frogogSupply.note: Note: FrogOG maintains a 1:1 ratio with BNBFrog during conversion. The circulating supply of FrogOG matches the true circulating supply of BNBFrog after accounting for all burned and locked tokens.
frogogSupply.launchData: Launch Data: These figures were calculated at launch. The legacy BNBFrog token continues to burn tokens on each buy/sell transaction, so the actual circulating supply may be slightly lower than shown.

faq.title: Freedom Bridge Support
faq.subtitle: Answers to common questions about TigerOG, bridging, and Axelar.

cta.title: Still have questions?
cta.description: Join our community on Telegram or check the detailed Wiki for technical guides.

questions.q1: What is the purpose of converting my tokens?
questions.a1: Converting your tokens into TigerOG removes the transaction tax (often 10-12%) associated with the legacy token. It also allows you to bridge these tokens to other blockchains like Ethereum, Base, and more via Axelar, enabling access to new ecosystems.
questions.q2: Is it safe to use Freedom Bridge?
questions.a2: Yes. The protocol uses a secure Conversion contract and Axelar's Interchain Token Service. When you convert, your BNBTiger is permanently burned and you receive TigerOG at a 1:1 ratio. The burn mechanism ensures the total supply is properly managed across all chains.
questions.a3: Freedom Bridge itself does not charge a fee for converting. You only pay standard blockchain gas fees. Bridging between chains involves a cross-chain gas fee paid to Axelar to cover the relaying costs.
questions.q4: What happens if I lose my tokens?
questions.a4: TigerOG tokens behave like any other ERC20/BEP20 token. If you lose access to your wallet, they cannot be recovered. Always keep your private keys and recovery phrases secure.
questions.q5: Can I convert my TigerOG tokens back to BNBTiger?
questions.a5: No. Conversion is one-way. When you convert BNBTiger to TigerOG, your legacy tokens are permanently locked in the conversion contract. This is by design — TigerOG is the upgraded, tax-free version meant to replace the legacy token entirely.
questions.a6: We support multiple EVM chains via Axelar, including BNB Chain, Ethereum, Base, and more. Check the Wiki for the full list of supported networks.
questions.a7:
Bridging time depends on which chain you're sending FROM:

• Ethereum: 15-20 min (needs more confirmations)
• BSC & Avalanche: 2-4 min (fastest)
• Base, Linea, Polygon: 3-5 min

The app shows the estimated time before you bridge.
questions.q8: What are the circulating supplies of the OG tokens?
questions.a8:
Each OG token has a fixed circulating supply derived from its original BNB token, accounting for burned tokens, stuck contract balances, and locked LP:

• TigerOG: ~3.66 septillion (36.62% of original)
• LionOG: ~3.83 septillion (38.33% of original)
• FrogOG: ~8.39 septillion (83.86% of original)

See the Wiki for detailed breakdowns.
questions.q9: Why isn't the OG contract renounced?
questions.a9: Renouncing the contract would remove the ability to develop and add new chains in the future. While the contract will not be renounced for the foreseeable future, multiple signatures are required to make any changes. Also, no tokens or taxes are allocated to the team.
questions.q10: Why is the OG contract mintable?
questions.a10: Cross-chain bridging requires mint/burn functionality - tokens are burned when leaving a chain and minted when arriving. This keeps total supply constant across all networks. Minting is controlled by a multisig Safe wallet.
questions.q11: Is TigerOG leaving BNB Chain for Axelar?
questions.a11: No. Axelar is not a blockchain - it's the bridging protocol that connects chains together. BNB Chain remains the origin chain where you convert legacy tokens. Axelar simply enables your tokens to move between BNB, Ethereum, Base, and other supported networks.
questions.a12: Make sure you add the chain and token address to your wallet. You can find all contract addresses on the Contracts page. The Tiger team uses Rabby wallet which makes managing multiple chains easier.
questions.q13: Why is bridging from Ethereum or Base taking so long?
questions.a13: Ethereum requires two epochs before finalizing transactions for maximum security. Since Base settles on Ethereum, it inherits this delay. This prioritizes security over speed - your tokens are safe, just be patient.
questions.q14: What happens if I stay in my original token and don't convert?
questions.a14: There is no rush to convert. BNBTiger and TigerOG will always have different liquidity pools, market caps, and so on. But BNBTiger has a high tax and TigerOG has no tax for trading. Since the taxes on the original aren't used to support the project, development is done by the CTO team for TigerOG. Freedom Bridge and multi-chain is only for TigerOG.
questions.q15: Is there a tax to convert? Does TigerOG have a tax?
questions.a15: No. It only costs the normal gas fee to convert and trade. There are no additional taxes or fees, and TigerOG is a tax-free contract.
questions.q16: Can I just buy and trade TigerOG directly?
questions.a16: Not yet. The team hasn't collected fees and taxes to be able to fund large enough liquidity pools. To get TigerOG now, you have to buy or already own the original and convert. Once you own TigerOG, it won't be easily traded until investors come to add to the liquidity pool.
questions.q17: Why does the TigerOG market cap look so inflated?
questions.a17: The smaller a liquidity pool, the more any small trade makes a huge impact on the displayed market cap. This resolves once investors come to be liquidity providers.
questions.q18: What security audits have been done?
questions.a18: Freedom Bridge has not undergone a formal third-party audit. However, the converter contract code is based on the SHx converter built by the Stronghold team (former XRP and Stellar developers who recently presented at Davos). The bridging infrastructure is powered by Axelar, which has undergone multiple security audits.
questions.q19: How does Freedom Bridge protect against hacks or exploits?
questions.a19:
Several measures are in place:

• The converter only holds the exact circulating supply needed - no excess tokens that could be exploited
• The converter has no mint permissions
• All contract code is verified on-chain and open source
• Token permissions are secured in a Safe.global multisig wallet
• Bridging is handled by Axelar's battle-tested infrastructure
questions.q20: Is bridging irreversible? What if a transfer fails?
questions.a20: Bridge transfers can rarely get stuck due to insufficient gas or network congestion. If this happens, you can track your transaction on Axelarscan and manually add gas to complete it. Axelar provides transaction recovery tools - you won't lose your tokens.
questions.q21: What are the risks associated with using Freedom Bridge?
questions.a21: As with any DeFi protocol, there are inherent risks including smart contract risk, bridge risk, and market volatility. We recommend doing your own research (DYOR) and only using funds you can afford to lose. See our legal disclaimer for more information.
questions.q22: Can I convert the new BNB Tiger Inu contract (September 2025)?
questions.a22: No. Freedom Bridge supports the original/legacy BNB Tiger token that launched several years ago - not the new contract created in September 2025. Freedom Bridge was built for the community takeover (CTO) of the original Tiger, Lion, and Frog tokens.
questions.a23: Adding liquidity is an advanced DeFi activity with risks including impermanent loss. If you're experienced with providing liquidity on DEXs like PancakeSwap or Uniswap, the process is the same - pair the OG token with a base asset. Here's a great educational series on liquidity if you want to learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oiylIHvwMik&list=PL_ujg_v1hZ5iGtiuhT8NkSMqEOaLAgmUu
questions.a24: No. There is no mechanism for a rug pull. No tokens or taxes are allocated to the team, and we don't collect any bridging fees — those go to Axelar for relaying costs. The team are holders just like you, building this at personal expense. The only team wallet is a public marketing wallet funded by community donations. The multisig Safe wallet controls contract permissions such as pausing sending to chains in case of emergency, but cannot access or redirect user funds.

disclaimer.title: Legal Disclaimer
disclaimer.subtitle: Please read this disclaimer carefully before using Freedom Bridge.

noInvestmentAdvice.title: No Investment Advice
noInvestmentAdvice.content: The information provided on Freedom Bridge does not constitute investment advice, financial advice, trading advice, or any other sort of advice. You should not treat any of the content as such. Freedom Bridge does not recommend that any cryptocurrency should be bought, sold, or held by you. Do conduct your own due diligence and consult your financial advisor before making any investment decisions.

risksOfUse.title: Risks of Use
risksOfUse.content:
Cryptocurrency markets are volatile and unpredictable. By using Freedom Bridge, you acknowledge and accept that:

• Smart contracts may contain bugs or vulnerabilities that could result in loss of funds
• Cross-chain bridges carry inherent risks including but not limited to: oracle failures, validator collusion, and network congestion
• Token values can fluctuate dramatically and you may lose some or all of your investment
• Transactions on blockchain networks are irreversible
• Network fees and gas costs are beyond our control and may vary significantly

noWarranties.title: No Warranties
noWarranties.content: Freedom Bridge is provided "as is" and "as available" without any warranties of any kind, either express or implied. We do not guarantee that the service will be uninterrupted, secure, or error-free. We make no warranties regarding the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of any information provided through the platform.

limitationOfLiability.title: Limitation of Liability
limitationOfLiability.content: To the maximum extent permitted by law, Freedom Bridge, its developers, contributors, and affiliates shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of or related to your use of the platform, including but not limited to loss of profits, loss of data, or loss of cryptocurrency assets.

thirdPartyServices.title: Third-Party Services
thirdPartyServices.content: Freedom Bridge integrates with third-party services including Axelar Network for cross-chain bridging. We are not responsible for the actions, content, information, or data of these third parties. Your use of third-party services is subject to their respective terms and conditions.

regulatoryCompliance.title: Regulatory Compliance
regulatoryCompliance.content: Cryptocurrency regulations vary by jurisdiction. You are solely responsible for ensuring that your use of Freedom Bridge complies with all applicable laws and regulations in your jurisdiction. Freedom Bridge does not make any representations regarding the legality of the services in any jurisdiction.

dyor.title: Do Your Own Research
dyor.content: Always do your own research (DYOR) before interacting with any DeFi protocol. Verify contract addresses, understand the mechanics of any token you interact with, and never invest more than you can afford to lose.

disclaimer.acknowledgment: By using Freedom Bridge, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by this disclaimer.

disclaimerModal.title: Important Disclaimer
disclaimerModal.subtitle: Please read and acknowledge before proceeding.
disclaimerModal.noAdvice: Freedom Bridge does not provide investment, financial, or trading advice. Cryptocurrency investments are volatile and risky.
disclaimerModal.risks: By using this platform, you acknowledge that smart contracts may contain vulnerabilities, cross-chain bridges carry inherent risks, and transactions are irreversible.
disclaimerModal.dyor: Always do your own research (DYOR) and only use funds you can afford to lose.
